Mr* Seymour Siegel
President
NAEB
New York City, N.Y.
Dear Si:
Glad to have your letter of January 7 regarding my letter on the
Headquarters* operation and I am also glad to know that you concur in
my opinion that the Executive Director is a creature of the Board and
as such should follow directives of the Board. A number of things that
have happened this year have made me regret that I did not push for this
Executive Director's job the first year. I honestly feel that I could
have carried out the intent of the office and the needs of the organi¬
zation more effectively than Jim is doing. He has the grandiose idea
that his is a sort of super executive position set up to run NAEB busi¬
ness, including all the responsibilities formerly assumed by the Board
and President. }fy reason for writing you concerning this is to urge
that at this up-coming meeting you assume full control of the Board
meeting and the discussions and direct your questions to the Board for
settling rather than giving Jim the ball to run with. A specific point
which will illustrate what I mean was an incident that occurred at the
Gotham meeting in September. I reacted with some surprise when you
turned to Jim and asked if we could pay Siepmann an honorarium at the
fall convention from the Kellogg Foundation money. My feeling at the
time was that it should have been a question settled by the Board with
a directive to Jim instructing him to pay Siepmann, if the Board decided
that it was a legitimate expenditure.
I shall try between now and the 18th to draw up a blueprint for
presentation at the Board meeting of my understanding of the relation¬
ship between the Kellogg Foundation, the Executive Director, and the
Board of Directors-a rehash of my letter of January 26.
If you have any specific suggestions, ideas, or reactions which
you would like me to present or would like*%o be giving special thought
or consideration prior to the meeting, please let roe know by return
mail. I hope we can get a working blueprint on paper as well as in the
minds of all members of the Board and all connected with the organiza¬
tion at this meeting.
After checking schedules, I had better plan to get into New York
on the afternoon of the 17th. January is a bad month for flying and
it will be pushing my luck too far to depend on the night flight which
gets into New York at 6:00 on schedule but which is cancelled frequently.
Please ask Terry to reserve my room at the Gotham for Thursday night.
